thread.title: Hypocrisy from the pope and the Vatican: Letters to the Editor
thread.title_full: Hypocrisy from the pope and the Vatican: Letters to the Editor | OregonLive.com

author: Letters to the editor
title: Hypocrisy from the pope and the Vatican: Letters to the Editor
text:
Pope: Like all religious leaders, it's "do what I say, not what I do." The Vatican is sitting on top of an art treasure estimated to be worth over $10 billion. Why doesn't the church sell off this treasure and all of its other holdings to help the poor and dispossessed? The pope is a total hypocrite. He should read his Bible. In Matthew 19:21, Jesus says to the rich man, "If you wish to be perfect, go sell your possessions and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me."
Warren Wylie
Aloha
